name: Acousticophobia
description: fear of noise – a branch of phonophobia

name: Aichmophobia
description: fear of sharp or pointed objects such as a needle or knife

name: Alliumphobia
description: fear of the strong-scented Allium genus: garlic, onions, chives, shallots

name:
Apeirophobia

excessive
description: fear of infinity, eternity, and the uncountable

name: Apotemnophobia
description: fear of amputees, and/or of becoming an amputee

name: Aquaphobia
description: fear of water. Distinct from hydrophobia, a scientific property that makes chemicals averse to interaction with water, as well as an archaic name for rabies.

name: Arachnophobia
description: fear of spiders and other arachnids such as scorpions, a zoophobia

name: Atychiphobia
description: fear of failure or negative evaluations of others

name: Basophobia, basiphobia
description: fear associated with astasia-abasia (fear of walking/standing erect) and a fear of falling

name: Batrachophobia
description: fear /dislike of frogs and other amphibians, a zoophobia

name: Chronophobia
description: fear of time and time moving forward

name: Claustrophobia
description: fear of having no escape and being closed in

name: Dental
description: fear , odontophobia fear of dentists and dental procedures

name: Diagraphephobia
description: fear of deleting files or an extreme fear of losing your computer data.

name: Eisoptrophobia
description: fear of mirrors or seeing one's reflection in a mirror

name: Ephebiphobia
description: fear of youth; inaccurate, exaggerated and sensational characterization of young people

name: Ergophobia, ergasiophobia
description: fear of work or functioning, or a surgeon's fear of operating

name: Erotophobia
description: fear of sexual love or sexual abuse

name: Erythrophobia, erytophobia, ereuthophobia
description: fear of the color red, or fear of blushing

name: Genuphobia
description: fear of knees or the act of kneeling

name: Gerascophobia
description: fear of growing old or aging

name: Gerontophobia
description: fear of growing old, or a hatred or fear of the elderly

name: Glossophobia
description: fear of speaking in public or of trying to speak

name: Heliophobia
description: fear of the sun or sunlight

name: Herpetophobia
description: fear /dislike of reptiles or amphibians, a zoophobia

name: Ichthyophobia
description: fear of fish, including fear of eating fish, or fear of dead fish, a zoophobia

name: Lepidopterophobia
description: fear of butterflies and moths, a zoophobia

name: Masklophobia
description: fear of people in masks, costumes and mascots

name: Monophobia
description: fear of being alone or isolated or of one's self

name: Musophobia, murophobia, suriphobia
description: fear /dislike of mice or rats, a zoophobia

name: Mysophobia, germophobia
description: fear of germs, contamination or dirt

name: Necrophobia
description: fear of death or the dead

name: Neophobia, cainophobia, cainotophobia, centophobia, kainolophobia, kainophobia, metathesiophobia, prosophobia
description: fear of newness, novelty, change or progress

name: Nomophobia
description: fear of being out of mobile phone contact

name: Oikophobia
description: fear of home surroundings and household appliances

name: Panphobia
description: fear of everything or constant fear of an unknown cause

name: Phobophobia
description: fear of fear itself or of having a phobia

name: Phonophobia
description: fear of loud sounds or voices

name:
Pornophobia

dislike or
description: fear of pornography; may be used in reference to the opposition to visual nudity

name: Scopophobia
description: fear of being looked at or stared at

name: Sexophobia
description: fear of sexual organs or sexual activities

name: Social phobia
description: fear of people or social situations

name: Submechanophobia
description: fear of partially or fully submerged man-made objects

name: Taphophobia, taphephobia
description: fear of graves, or fear of being placed in a grave while still alive

name: Technophobia
description: fear of advanced technology (see also Luddite)

name: Telephone phobia
description: fear or reluctance of making or taking telephone calls

name: Teratophobia
description: fear of giving birth to a monster or a disfigured foetus

name: Thalassophobia
description: fear of the sea, or fear of being in the ocean

name: Thermophobia
description: fear of intolerance to high temperatures

name:
Traumatophobia

a synonym for injury phobia:

Trichophobia

delusional
description: fear of something in the roots of the hair that stops it from growing, or fear of hair loss

name: Trypophobia
description: fear of holes or textures with a pattern of holes

name: Workplace phobia
description: fear of the workplace, a subset of ergophobia

name: Gerontophobia, gerascophobia
description: fear /dislike of aging or the elderly

name: Homophobia
description: fear /dislike of homosexuality, homosexuals, or gays (as opposed to lesbians)

name: Psychophobia
description: fear /dislike of mental illness or the mentally ill

name: Anglophobia
description: fear /dislike of England or English culture

name: Hispanophobia
description: fear /dislike of Hispanic people, Hispanic culture and the Spanish language

name: Indophobia
description: fear /dislike of India or Indian culture

name: Indonesiaphobia
description: fear /dislike of Indonesia or Indonesian culture

name: Iranophobia
description: fear /dislike of Iran or Iranian culture

name: Lusophobia
description: fear /dislike of the Portuguese, Portuguese culture and the Portuguese language

name: Bibliophobia
description: fear or hatred of books, as a cultural phenomenon
